de.jannlab.core

Class NetData

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.jannlab.core.NetData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class NetData
extends Object
implements Serializable
    An instance of this class contains the entire data of an ANN. This are on one hand the data buffers for forward and backward computation (input, ouput, gradinput, gradoutput) for each time step (the timesteps are defined by the frame width).
    Author:
    Sebastian Otte
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int[] asgns
      Stores the indices to the cells used for constant value assignments.
      double[] asgnsv
      Stores the constant values assignments corresponding to the indices given in asgns.
      int framewidth
      determines the frame width, which is the first dimension of the data buffers.
      double[][] gradinput
      provides the grad. input buffer. the results of the backward integrations and also the network error are stored here.
      double[][] gradoutput
      provides the grad. output buffer. the results of the activation deviations and also the "back-flowing" error are stored here.
      double[][] input
      provides the input buffer. the results of the forward integrations are stored here.
      double[][] output
      provides the output buffer. the results of the forward activations and also the network input are stored here.
      double[] weights
      provides the vector of weigts. note that the first value of the vector is generally 1.0. this is founded in some runtime peformance improvements concerning non weighted links.
      int weightsnum
      Gives the number of weights exclusive the constant 1.0 weight.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NetData() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      NetData copy()
      Makes a complete "real" copy of the current data record including the weight vectors.
      NetData sharedCopy()
      This method returns a shared copy of the current data record.

    • Field Detail

      • input

        public double[][] input
        provides the input buffer. the results of the forward integrations are stored here.

      • output

        public double[][] output
        provides the output buffer. the results of the forward activations and also the network input are stored here.

      • gradinput

        public double[][] gradinput
        provides the grad. input buffer. the results of the backward integrations and also the network error are stored here.

      • gradoutput

        public double[][] gradoutput
        provides the grad. output buffer. the results of the activation deviations and also the "back-flowing" error are stored here.

      • framewidth

        public int framewidth
        determines the frame width, which is the first dimension of the data buffers. MLPs or trained RNNs only need a frame width of 1. Online offline computing RNNs or online computing RNNs during training need a frame width > 1.

      • weights

        public double[] weights
        provides the vector of weigts. note that the first value of the vector is generally 1.0. this is founded in some runtime peformance improvements concerning non weighted links.

      • weightsnum

        public int weightsnum
        Gives the number of weights exclusive the constant 1.0 weight.

      • asgns

        public int[] asgns
        Stores the indices to the cells used for constant value assignments.

      • asgnsv

        public double[] asgnsv
        Stores the constant values assignments corresponding to the indices given in asgns.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NetData

        public NetData()

    • Method Detail

      • sharedCopy

        public NetData sharedCopy()
        This method returns a shared copy of the current data record. This means that the entire data buffer is "really" duplicated while the weights and the assignments are shared. A shared copy can be used for independent computations on the same weights vector, which is an important requirement for computing/training the same problem in parallel with multiple Net instances.

        Returns:
        Copy of this data record with shared weights and assigments.

      • copy

        public NetData copy()
        Makes a complete "real" copy of the current data record including the weight vectors. No data is shared between the copy and original instance.
        Returns:
        A copy of this data record.
